DOC.brief_summary: In present study , investigator propose conversion scheme 50 % reduction CNI dosage adjustment everolimus dosage , order reach trough blood level 6-10 ng/mL , thus avoid overimmunosuppression alternatively breakthrough rejection episode . The hypothesis study demonstrate therapeutic regimen Myfortic® Certican® significantly improve renal function compare standard regimen CNI .
DOC.brief_title: Study Everolimus de Novo Renal Transplant Recipients
DOC.criteria: Renal transplant patient Age 18 85 year Recipients live deceased donor Donor age 85 year Panel Reactivity Antibodies ( PRA ) equal 30 % 45 month posttransplant CNIbased immunosuppressive regimen Stable graft function ( creatinine low 2.0 mg/dl ) No currently acute rejection Proteinuria low 800mg/d No laboratory physical clinically significant sign present last 2 month screen . Recipient multiple organ Recipient history focal segmental glomerulosclerosis membranous glomerulonephritis Presence uncontrolled hypercholesterolemia ( ≥350 mg/dL ) hypertriglyceridemia ( equal 500 mg/dL ) Patients eGFR low 40 ml/min/1.73m2 Evidence acute rejection within 2 month screen Thrombocytopenia ( low 75,000/mm3 ) Neutropenia ( low 1,500/mm3 ) Leukocytopenia ( low 2500/mm3 ) Anemia ( hemoglobin low 6.0g/dL ) Severe liver disease ( include transaminase bilirubin equal 3 time normal ) Proteinuria 800mg/dL Systemic infection pneumonia ( active infection ) Positive Hepatitis B , Hepatitis C HIV .
